ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Exposure to and discussion of a wide variety of modern ethnographic anthropological research on Japan. Highly recommended.
Yes, if the student is doing anything Japan/Asia-related in any field.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Although this course was not directly applicable to my research, the exposure to anthropological methods, approach, and recent research was very inspirational in getting me to think about my research questions in new ways. In addition, each week's wide-ranging discussion encouraged -- often demanded -- extended critical thinking, from definition and reappraisal of my own attitudes toward anthropology to Japanese society to the study of culture in general. As I prepare to begin a PhD program next year, everything I gained from this course feels extremely valuable.
